data.title: Failed to load the atom-jshinter package
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. ...
2. ...

**Atom Version**: 1.0.18
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.5
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Failed to load the atom-jshinter package

```
At Cannot read property 'prototype' of undefined

TypeError: Cannot read property 'prototype' of undefined
    at __extends (<anonymous>:1:1)
    at <anonymous>:4:3
    at Object.<anonymous> (<anonymous>:4:3)
    at Object.<anonymous> (<anonymous>:1:1)
    at Module._compile (module.js:428:26)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .coffee] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:169:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:353:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:308:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:363:17)
    at require (module.js:382:17)
```
### Commands

```
```
### Config

``` json

  "core": {
    "disabledPackages": [
      "css-color-highlight",

}
```

data.body:

data.title: Hitting Esc on a dialog box should perform the most conservative option
data.body: For instance, on Cmd-Q, a dialog box comes up, and I hit Esc because I hit the keybinding by mistake in the first place. No changes are saved and my editor quits!

data.title: Atom always shows checking for updates message and is not gonna upgraded
data.body:
I have the atom Version 1.0.3 as you see in the screenshot below. I want to update it to latest version that released in http://atom.io (1.0.18 October 2015) but i can't. It is always showing «checking for updates» message and don't download app updates. Is there any way or package to update my atom with User Interface or at least show me what is the problem with updating operations?

![update_issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9091958/10100259/422b12e8-639d-11e5-96ff-5d3978377789.png)

data.title: Fix build failures for Electron 32 upgrade
data.body:
This introduces a couple of commits that fix [those spec failures](https://travis-ci.org/atom/atom/builds/81909632) we are observing in #8779 :green_heart:.

These are pretty straightforward, but it'd be great to have a second pair of :eyes:.

Thanks! :bow: 

/cc: @atom/feedback @zcbenz

data.title: Atom running wild on memory
data.body:
I rarely use Atom, I have it here for editing some random files, but I normally use a full blown IDE when working on bigger projects or vim when editing on the server.

I opened .vimrc with atom (wtf right? haha), and then this happens : 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/83322/10099785/d6146c66-6384-11e5-99a9-6105f7a5a2ee.png)

If you notice, its using 31GB of ram (getting paged to disk because i only have 16).

Closing it again and reopening gives me this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/83322/10099812/20b3ce1a-6385-11e5-804e-e70cc34299f1.png)

I am pretty sure its something related to some plugin. How can I pinpoint what plugin it is so I can bug report to them?

PS: if you notice, PHPStorm has 666 for the port count, maybe he is acting evil and corrupting his brother for me choosing to open Atom :P

data.title: Global gitignore
data.body:
In git there is possibility to use global .gitignore:

`git config --global core.excludesfile '~/.gitignore'`

Atom doesn't show files ignored by that excludefile as ignored. And shows them as new files (green in tree).

data.title: Wrong file title after save-as
data.body: After saving file with different name by save-as / ctr+shift+S, when hover over tab, old title is displayed.

data.title: tree-view package settings should be more accessible
data.body:
Since there are many bytecode languages out there (Java, python, ...) one would naturally want to hide the bytecode files from what Atom has as a "Package Explorer". This is a task that many users would like to perform. Currently, this requires changing the Core settings as well as the tree-view package settings. The problem here is that a) tree-view is not an obvious name and b) one does not expect it to be treated, from the GUI perspective, as one of the 78 non-core standard packages of Atom.

This is a GUI design issue and I think it can cause frustration and waste serious time for the average user. It certainly did for me.

data.title: need a md5sum hash value of release packages
data.body:
I downloaded AtomSetup.exe(1.0.18) . After a while I forgot I downloaded ,so I downloaded AtomSetup.exe(1.0.18) again .
Now I have to setup_packages in my download_folder, but I find they don't have the same size .I use HashMyFiles to checksum them ,and ,of course , they don't match to each other.
I don't know why they are different .I think there may be some network problems .

But I cann't verify which package is the right package, I think there should be a hash value list of release packages .Just like centos.org  ,they provide a md5sum.txt to tell the md5 of the iso files.

There is already a RELEASES ,but it only about the nupkg files, and is that SHA1 or what ?

Some days ago a malware called 'xcodeghost' cames out .XcodeGhost is a compiler malware in OS X. Its malicious code is located in a Mach-O object file that was repackaged into some versions of Xcode installers. I'm afraid there may be someone do the same to Atom in the future .

So I think there should be a md5sum.txt or something like that in the page of releases page for users to verify the setup_files.

data.title: Make it easier to add top/bottom bars
data.body:
From this discussion: https://discuss.atom.io/t/placing-element-at-top-of-atom-for-package/21118
#### Problem:

Currently you can't easily add a bar to the top or bottom that spans across the whole width. If you try, it pushes down the status bar. I guess because `atom-workspace-axis` has `height: 100%`.

![screen shot 2015-09-25 at 3 22 20 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/10094309/40c5935a-6399-11e5-92df-bc56f4986499.png)

An option is to add it above/below the editor, like `tool-bar` currently does, but that might not be desired for all packages.
#### Possible solution:

Add two empty `<atom-panel-container>` as children of `<atom-workspace>`. They're just placeholders and won't take up space if they are empty, but it would allow other packages to fill them.

![atom-panels](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/10159023/c0848db4-66d0-11e5-9cbe-fadbfa2bd110.png)

data.title: Accept tags files that use line number, not just complete line search
data.body:
See https://github.com/elaforge/fast-tags/issues/19

Whereas Vim will accept tags files that just have a number in the command (jump to definition means go to the given line number), Atom _only_ accepts the text string of the complete line for a search. This means less flexibility in working with various tools that create tags files.

Atom should be updated to accept the line number approach. Incidentally, Atom _does_ work with such files to at least search by tag and go to the right file, but it totally fails to jump to definitions under the cursor when the tags file uses just line numbers rather than full text.

data.title: Atom 1.0.18 flashing window on Ubuntu 14.04
data.body:
Hi,

I just updated from Atom 1.0.15 to 1.0.18, and now it's completely unusable.
The atom window "flashes", showing the editor for one sec, and then showing the desktop wallpaper, and again.

FWIW, the same happens if Atom is run with the `safe` option.
Any idea ?

data.title: private config type
data.body: There should be a setting in the configuration api to make a config item _private_. With this flag activated when generating an automated bug report it won't print out any _private_ config keys. Specifically if the config api is being used to store api keys a user could accidentally report a bug that reveals their api key.

data.title: Stop adding project folders to the window
data.body: This is my single most painful papercut with Atom. Every time I open Atom with, e.g. `atom ~/.wine/system.reg`, Atom adds the WHOLE FOLDER (e.g. `.wine`) to the window, which blows up my memory and CPU and pollutes my search with millions of files I'm not interested in. I almost never want Atom to add and index the folder of the file I'm editing.

data.title: Upgrade text-buffer to fix serialization incompatibility
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8849
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8888

In https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/95, I added a field `load` to the `TextBuffer`'s serialization format. I did this because previously, text-buffers would always try to load when deserializing, even if they didn't have a file! Unfortunately, when I did this, I forgot to bump the serialization format. This caused text-buffers to deserialize without loading their underlying file, which caused the above two Atom issues.

In this latest version of `text-buffer`, I remove that `load` field. It was actually somewhat redundant; a better solution is to just avoid loading when buffers don't have a `filePath`.

data.title: Find/Replace drawer doesn't close
data.body:
On 1.0.12 (OS X) now after opening the Find/Replace drawer/sub-window, it does not close with the Esc button, nor does right-click and Close Pane work.  

It usually only closes after closing an open tab.

data.title: Link Gutter::decorateMarker to TextEditor::decorateMarker
data.body:
`Gutter::decorateMarker` passes its `decorationParams` object through to
`TextEditor::decorateMarker`. Rather than duplicate documentation and
fall out-of-date (as was surfaced in #8920), link the
`TextEditor::decorateMarker` as the canonical docs location.

data.title: Can't install/update Atom on Windows
data.body:
I had a working v1.0.7 of Atom, which couldn't update to later versions due to `PathTooLongException`s. So I uninstalled it completely and tried to re-install v1.0.15, which failed.

I tried again today with v1.0.9, but had no luck. This is the log of the installer:

data.title: :bug: fix atom.isValidDimensions under Mac (fixes #7555, fixes #8909)
data.body:
Additionally I have also:
- added logging when detected invalid dimensions
- changed logic for determining width and height after recovery from invalid dimensions

Original implementation was not symmetric. And I believe Math.min was a mistake. Original intent probably was to use Math.max instead.
It didn't guard against case of generating invalid width if screen.getPrimaryDisplay().workAreaSize returned 0 or some negative value.
And it was clamping width for displays wider than 1024 which makes little sense.

New implementation makes sure width is at least 1024 and height is at least 512 after reset.

Fixes #7555
Fixes #8909

data.title: Copy & pasting a file to the same directory will remove the extension
data.body:
If a file is copy/pasted in the Tree View, the extension will be removed.

Examples: 
`./style.min.css` will create `./style0.min`
`./script.min.js` will create `./script.min`
`./index.blade.php` will create `./index0.blade`
`./index.blade.php` copied to another directory is properly created as `../otherdir/index.blade.php`

Files like `index.html` are properly copied to `index0.html`

`atom --safe` doesn't help either.

Mac OS X 10.11
Atom 1.0.16

data.title: Upgrade to Electron 0.30.7
data.body:
Upgrades Electron to prevent a file handle leak on Windows and an uncaught exception when reading an invalid path in the `.asar` archives.

Refs https://github.com/atom/electron/issues/2871
Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8834
Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8882
Closes https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/580
Closes https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/653

data.title: Add Node 4 to Travis Build Matrix
data.body:
Closes #8923.

This is a continuation of #8923 that will allow us to test whether node 4 works correctly with our dependencies.

This will increase a bit the Travis backlog but this is only temporary, as we should be able to keep only the latest node version after we merge #8779.

/cc: @atom/feedback @mnquintana

data.title: Backup / Installable setup of atom
data.body: Would really love to have a single file that when imported/added somehow, atom will install the plugins specified... much like a spm/bower install :)

data.title: Settings -> Packages -> Deprecated Packages never loads
data.body:
- When going to this settings page it never loads..
- Number of installed packages is "..." on all packages groups
- Community Packages only shows one packages (todo-manager)
- Core Packages show all

some config file that is wrongly formated?

data.title: Fix runas requirement
data.body:
runas 2 doesn't build with a recent node.js

Closes #8922
Closes #8508

data.title: script/bootstrap failure installing runas@2.0.0 / node-gyp
data.body:
The build script tries to install runas@2.0.0, which fails due to incompatibilities with recent V8 headers (I'm running the latest node 4 from nvm).

```
$ script/build
…
gyp ERR! build error 
gyp ERR! stack Error: `make` failed with exit code: 2
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.onExit (~/var/co/git/atom/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/lib/build.js:269:23)
gyp ERR! stack     at emitTwo (events.js:87:13)
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:172:7)
gyp ERR! stack     at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:200:12)
gyp ERR! System Linux 4.2.0-10-generic
gyp ERR! command "~/var/co/git/nvm/versions/node/v4.1.1/bin/node" "~/var/co/git/atom/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "rebuild"
gyp ERR! cwd ~/var/co/git/atom/build/node_modules/runas
gyp ERR! node -v v4.1.1
gyp ERR! node-gyp -v v2.0.2
gyp ERR! not ok 
npm ERR! Linux 4.2.0-10-generic
npm ERR! argv "~/var/co/git/nvm/versions/node/v4.1.1/bin/node" "~/var/co/git/atom/build/node_modules/.bin/npm" "--userconfig=~/var/co/git/atom/build/.npmrc" "install" "--loglevel" "error"
npm ERR! node v4.1.1
npm ERR! npm  v2.13.3
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE

npm ERR! runas@2.0.0 install: `node-gyp rebuild`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the runas@2.0.0 install script 'node-gyp rebuild'.
npm ERR! This is most likely a problem with the runas package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
npm ERR! Tell the author that this fails on your system:
npm ERR!     node-gyp rebuild
npm ERR! You can get their info via:
npm ERR!     npm owner ls runas
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.
```

Root cause is the runas version; npm install runas@2.0.0 fails, npm install runas@3.1.0 succeeds.

data.title: Context menu doesn't open at mouse cursor position
data.body:
See this image:

![context-menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3612514/10071091/4e0f6ca8-62b7-11e5-8b8f-7e3483e827b0.gif)

When I right click to open the context menu, there's a few pixels in between the mouse cursor and the top-left corner of the context menu. It seems to get worse on the right side of the screen. I would expect the context menu's top-left corner to coincide with the mouse position. I could replicate this in safe mode, but not in google chrome v45.0.2454.99.

System details:
Atom 1.2.0-dev-0145ae3
Debian 9 with Openbox window manager

data.title: Custom Gutter component does not accept space in class list
data.body:
In linter, we need to provide a base class `linter-highlight` along with the error type as the class. Not being able to have a space in class pretty much cripples the abilities, furthermore, we are allowed spaces in classes in highlight markers so I believe it's an inconsistency.
I am talking about `custom-gutter-component` on lines https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/custom-gutter-component.coffee#L84-L88
cc @nathansobo
